subject: RE: [junit] The upcoming "assert" keyword in JDK 1.4
msgSnippet: ... If asserts aren t enabled at compile-time, then the assert keyword isn t really. The point of this is to allow legacy code to be compiled still. Robert.
messageBody:
Noah Green wrote:
> The question is whether not using this compile-time setting
> frees up the
> "assert" keyword for use as a method name. My fear is that it
> does not.

If asserts aren't enabled at compile-time, then the "assert" keyword isn't
really. The point of this is to allow legacy code to be compiled still.

Robert.

--
